name: Demonstration Projects for Indian Health
objective: To promote improved health care among American Indians and Alaska Natives through research studies and demonstration projects, addressing such issues as, but not limited to Women's Health Care, National Indian Health Outreach and Education I, II & III, Tribal Dental Clinical and Preventive Support Centers, National HIV Program, Healthy Lifestyles in Youth, and Native Public Health Resilience.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals
Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: 103 (B)(1), Public Health Service Act. Pub. L. 93, 638.

rules_regulations: 45 CFR 75, Health and Human Services Grants Policy Statement, January 2007.
